findings.title: Solidity assert violation.
findings.description: The Solidity assert statement has a vulnerability.

findings.title: Solidity AssertionFailed event
findings.description: The contract contains an assertion failed event which can lead to unexpected behavior and errors.

findings.title: Incorrect ERC20 implementation.
findings.description: The contract does not conform to the ERC20 standard.

findings.title: Outdated compiler version.
findings.description: The solidity versions used for the audited contracts are outdated and can cause known bugs such as EmptyByteArrayCopy and DynamicArrayCleanup.

findings.title: No or floating compiler version set
findings.description: Not setting a fixed compiler version can lead to compilation with an unsupported version, which may contain known bugs and vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of right-to-left-override control character
findings.description: The contract uses a right-to-left override control character which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Shadowing of built-in symbol.
findings.description: This finding indicates that a user-defined variable or function has the same name as a built-in Solidity symbol, which can lead to confusion and potential security issues.

findings.title: Incorrect constructor name.
findings.description: The contract's constructor has an incorrect name which can lead to unexpected behavior or errors.

findings.title: State variable shadows another state variable.
findings.description: A state variable is shadowing another state variable which can lead to unintended behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Local variable shadows a state variable
findings.description: A local variable is shadowing a state variable, which can lead to unintended behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Function parameter shadows a state variable
findings.description: A function parameter has the same name as a state variable, which can lead to unintended behavior and bugs.

findings.title: Named return value shadows a state variable
findings.description: This finding highlights a situation where a named return value in a function shadows a state variable, potentially leading to confusion and unintended behavior.

findings.title: Unary operation without effect Solidity code analysis
findings.description: The unary operation has no effect on the variable or expression it is applied to.

findings.title: Unary operation directly after assignment
findings.description: Potential issue with unary operations being performed immediately after variable assignments, which may lead to unintended behavior or errors.

findings.title: Unused state variable
findings.description: State variables declared but never used in the contract.

findings.title: Unused local variable
findings.description: The code has a local variable that is declared but never used.

findings.title: Function visibility is not set
findings.description: The function's visibility was not explicitly set.

findings.title: State variable visibility is not set
findings.description: The state variable's visibility is not explicitly defined.

findings.title: Use of deprecated functions: call code(), sha3(), …
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated functions such as call code(), sha3(), etc.

findings.title: Use of deprecated global variables (msg.gas, ...)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated global variables such as msg.gas which can lead to compatibility issues and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of deprecated keywords (throw, var)
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity keywords 'throw' and 'var', which can lead to compatibility issues and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Incorrect function state mutability.
findings.description: The function's state mutability is incorrectly set, which can lead to unintended behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Does the code conform to the Solidity styleguide
findings.description: The code does not follow the recommended Solidity coding style guide

findings.title: Non-Conforming Solidity Code Structure
findings.description: The code does not conform to the Solidity styleguide.
